title: Brokerages Expect Otter Tail Co. (OTTR) Will Post Earnings of $0.47 Per Share
content: Wall Street brokerages forecast that Otter Tail Co. (NASDAQ:OTTR) will report $0.47 earnings per share (EPS) for the current quarter, according to Zacks . Zero analysts have made estimates for Otter Tail’s earnings. Otter Tail reported earnings of $0.42 per share in the same quarter last year, which indicates a positive year over year growth rate of 11.9%. The firm is expected to report its next earnings results  on Monday, August 6th.    According to Zacks, analysts expect that Otter Tail will report full-year earnings of $2.00 per share for the current fiscal year. For the next financial year, analysts expect that the company will post earnings of $2.10 per share. Zacks Investment Research’s EPS averages are an average based on a survey of analysts that follow Otter Tail.    Get Otter Tail alerts:      Otter Tail (NASDAQ:OTTR) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, May 7th. The utilities provider reported $0.66 EPS for the quarter, topping the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.53 by $0.13. Otter Tail had a return on equity of 11.57% and a net margin of 9.02%. The firm had revenue of $241.30 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $224.90 million. During the same quarter last year, the business posted $0.49 earnings per share. The firm’s revenue was up 12.7% compared to the same quarter last year.    OTTR has been the topic of a number of analyst reports. Zacks Investment Research upgraded Otter Tail from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $45.00 price objective on the stock in a research report on Wednesday, March 7th. BidaskClub upgraded Otter Tail from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a research report on Wednesday, February 21st. Williams Capital  reiterated a “hold” rating and set a $42.00 price objective (up previously from $41.00) on shares of Otter Tail in a research report on Thursday, February 15th. Finally, ValuEngine upgraded Otter Tail from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a research report on Wednesday, May 2nd. One investment analyst  has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned  a hold rating and three have assigned  a buy rating to the company’s stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $45.67.  Otter Tail stock traded down $0.65 during trading on Friday, reaching $45.55. 146,806 shares of the company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 94,539. Otter Tail has a 52-week low of $38.75 and a 52-week high of $48.65. The company has a market cap of $1.91 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 24.49 and a beta of 0.63. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.83, a quick ratio of 0.92 and a current ratio of 1.45.    The firm also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Saturday, June 9th. Shareholders of record on Tuesday, May 15th will be given a $0.335 dividend. The ex-dividend date is Monday, May 14th. This represents a $1.34 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 2.94%. Otter Tail’s dividend payout ratio  is currently 72.04%.    In other Otter Tail news, CFO Kevin G. Moug sold 1,500 shares of Otter Tail stock in a transaction on Tuesday, May 15th. The stock was sold at an average price of $43.48, for a total value of $65,220.00. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which is available at this link . 1.70% of the stock is owned by insiders.    A number of large investors have recently bought and sold shares of OTTR. Institutional & Family Asset Management LLC purchased a new stake in  Otter Tail in the first quarter valued at $101,000.  Perigon Wealth Management LLC raised its holdings in shares of  Otter Tail by 70.4% in the 1st quarter. Perigon Wealth Management LLC now owns 3,352 shares of the utilities provider’s stock valued at $145,000 after buying an additional 1,385 shares during the period.  Wealth Alliance Advisory Group LLC purchased a new stake in shares of  Otter Tail in the 1st quarter valued at $208,000.  Ellington Management Group LLC purchased a new stake in shares of  Otter Tail in the 4th quarter valued at $244,000.  Finally, Raymond James & Associates purchased a new stake in shares of  Otter Tail in the 4th quarter valued at $252,000. Institutional investors own  42.78% of the company’s stock.    Otter Tail Company Profile    Otter Tail Corporation, together with its subsidiaries, engages in electric, manufacturing, and plastics businesses in the United States. The company's Electric segment produces, transmits, distributes, and sells electric energy in Minnesota, North Dakota, and South Dakota; and operates as a participant in the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc markets.
